availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Agency located in Washington, D.C. that prosecuted all claims for compensation against the Federal Government for the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Kentucky soldiers, and citizens. Agent for the State of Kentucky: Charles D. Pennebaker.

ab.bibl:
"An Act to Establish a Claim Agency for Kentucky in the City of Washington," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, Ky.: William E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 109-11.
Charles D. Pennebaker, "Report of the State Agent for Kentucky, At Washington, Made to the Governor, December 2, 1867," (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 1-16.
Civil War Soldier Compensation Correspondence, 1866-1868, SC 1291, Kentucky Historical Society, Frankfort, Kentucky.
